body:
One way would be to use [`QueryBuilder`](http://typeorm.io/#/select-query-builder):
```
const data = await connection
    .getRepository(User)
    .createQueryBuilder("user")
    .where("user.id < :id", { id: 10 })
    .andWhere("user.id in (:ids)", { ids: [1,2,3] })
    .execute();
```

You can get `getSql`, `getQuery`, or `getQueryAndParameters` to check the raw SQL that will be generated for a query:
```
const data = await connection
    .getRepository(User)
    .createQueryBuilder("user")
    .where("user.id < :id", { id: 10 })
    .andWhere("user.id in (:ids)", { ids: [1,2,3] })
    .getSql();

console.log(data); // <-- select * from user where id < $1 and id in($2);
```

EDIT:
I actually need to update my answer. It looks like paramter mapping doesn't work for arrays, so you have use string concatenation like:
```
const ids = [1,2,3];
const data = await connection
    .getRepository(User)
    .createQueryBuilder("user")
    .where("user.id < :id", { id: 10 })
    .andWhere(`user.id in (${ids})`)
    .execute();
```
Hopefully someone from the core team can weigh in and confirm/disprove.

currently you can only use suggestions from above ^^

We need to introduce some new syntax to handle your case as well with find options.
@pleerock Any update on this? I agree that adding an `And` operator would be the best option.
Please. Apply And Or syntax. Like prisma do.
Would love to see this implemented.
Can we get an update on if there are plans to implement this?
